vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection via exec()
vulnerabilities.description: exec() method detected. Use ProcessBuilder with arguments array instead.

vulnerabilities.title: Potential SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: SQL query execution via executeQuery. Use PreparedStatement with parameterized queries.

vulnerabilities.title: Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before code injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-749: Exposed Dangerous Method (would need Flask context but testing pattern)
def dangerous_eval():
    code = "print('hello')"
    return eval(code)  # Dangerous method

vulnerabilities.title: Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before code injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
def dangerous_eval():
    code = "print('hello')"
    return eval(code)  # Dangerous method

# CWE-770: Resource Exhaustion

vulnerabilities.title: Weak JWT Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: Using weak JWT algorithm (HS256 or none). Use RS256 or stronger algorithms.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet: token = jwt.encode(payload, JWT_SECRET, algorithm='HS256')  # CWE-327: Weak JWT Algorithm

vulnerabilities.title: Missing JWT Signature Verification
vulnerabilities.description: JWT decoding without signature verification. Always verify JWT signatures.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet: decoded = jwt.decode(token, options={"verify_signature": False})  # CWE-295: Missing Signature Verification

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before command injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
host = request.args.get('host', 'localhost')
    # Vulnerable: Passing user input to shell command
    result = os.system(f"ping -c 1 {host}")
    return str(result)

vulnerabilities.title: Unsafe Deserialization
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before unsafe deserialization.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
data = request.data
    # Vulnerable: Unpickling untrusted data
    obj = pickle.loads(data)
    return str(obj)
